intro: Froelichia arizonica, commonly known as the Arizona froelichia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a shrub that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as desertscrub and rocky areas. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by small, round fruits. Its leaves are usually narrow and grayish-green, adapted to reduce water loss in hot, dry climates. Froelichia arizonica is an important species for local wildlife, providing food and habitat for various insects and birds.
